data.title: Robovm doesnt properly work with g3d particles
data.body:
when running to an ios simulator with the gradle task, the game will crash with an error about needing to force link some classes related to the g3d particle emitter when trying to load a .pfx file with the asset manager.

To fix this i've added < pattern >com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g3d.particles.**< /pattern > inside of the < forceLinkClasses > tags in robovm.xml and was then able to run the game just fine.

I think it would be a good idea to add this to the xml file by default so others wouldnt have to figure this out the hard way too. I'd make a pull request for this but I'm not sure where the robovm.xml file is created.

data.title: Wrong stage-to-local transform when the root is not identity
data.body:
1. Make a `Scene` with an `InputListener`
2. Change the scene's root position

=> touch positions are not adjusted to the root's local coordinate system.

This is because `Actor.stageToLocalCoordinates()` does nothing for root, whose parent is null.

For comparison `Stage.hit()` does the root transformation correctly.

data.title: Crash in native code with Pixmap
CpuSpriteBatch - fix #2630
data.body: I propose removing the automatic sync at `CpuSpriteBatch.end()`. The real matrix should never be altered unless the user requests it explicitly via `flushAndSyncTransformMatrix()`. This prevents an issue where ending the batch while drawing a group with scale 0 leads to singular real matrix and crash.

data.title: Add easy Heiro font GUI startup from Gradle (code fragment included)
data.body:
Hi,
This isn't an issue really, I added the following simple Gradle Heiro font GUI start-up task and thought I'd share it with the community, it might come in useful for boot-strapping other tools, too.

Just add the following to the bottom of the main 'build.gradle' file (i.e. the code **_doesn't**_ have to belong to a particular sub-project):

```
task fontGui (type: JavaExec) {
    main = "com.badlogic.gdx.tools.hiero.Hiero"
    classpath = project(':desktop').sourceSets.main.runtimeClasspath
}
```

This will then add a new 'gradlew **fontGui**' task (you could also call '**gradlew fG**', Gradle is clever like that :-D )

The most 'striking' part of this short fragment is **how to access the constructed classpath of a subproject (in this case 'desktop')**. Of course, there is a good amount of Gradle info out there, however, it can sometimes also be a little 'opaque', so finding examples like this can be helpful.

Hope this helps somebody.

data.title: Update stb_image from v1.33 to v1.48
data.body:
Should be straight forward, looks like no big modifications are required. Only change (besides from moving to a header file) is that the `stbi_unsupported_format` method seems to be removed (or is custom for libgdx). This is used in gdx2d to check for progressive jpeg, in which case jpgd is used. This check is not really needed as far as I can tell, because jpgd returns null in case loading fails. So with this PR it will simply try to load the file using stb, if that fails then try to load it using jpgd and if that fails return null.

Tested on win x64 and android.

Fixes #2650

Changes: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/jni/gdx2d/stb_image.h#L4709

data.title: Time consuming http request blocks other requests
data.body:
Consider downloading a 100 MB file. Reading the bytes of the http result stream will take several seconds to minutes. Now I want to make another request in the meantime, a much shorter one. However that does not work, because NetJavaImpl is acquiring a lock before it runs handleHttpRequest and releases it just after it. This restricts access to the connections and listeners maps to anything but the network thread itself. So the new http request will wait until the other one has finished.

I have fixed it locally by releasing the lock before handleHttpRequest gets locked and locking it again directly after it. 
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/net/NetJavaImpl.java#L200
